{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3557135,"name":"Jugad S.","username":"jsingh","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c37758/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T17:30:59.459Z","cooked":"

Hello,
We are having an issue where our elevator slams into the hard stop at the beginning of the mode. This doesn’t happen sometimes when we restart robot code, but always happens when we don’t. Here is our code. Any help would be greatly appreciated as our competition is this weekend and we can’t figure this out.
Thanks,
1391

Please use the SCH Branch when looking, it is the latest code.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-14T20:40:42.339Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":29.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495579,"topic_slug":"autonomous-elevator-slamming-into-hardstop","display_username":"Jugad S.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/autonomous-elevator-slamming-into-hardstop/495579/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3557292,"name":"Gavin","username":"Gavin0","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gavin0/{size}/193252_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T21:34:57.995Z","cooked":"

In teleopInit you’re setting your elevator’s setpoint to 0 ( m_robotContainer.elevatorReset();), so it makes sense that it should start going down, I’d imagine on code start the elevatorEncoder is set to 0, and so doesn’t move when the setpoint is set to that, thus not slamming. You could instead try setting your elevators setpoint to its current position.

How hard is it slamming? If it doesn’t look like its within your clamped speed speed = MathUtil.clamp(pidController.calculate(elevator.getElevatorPosition(), elevator.getSetpoint()), -0.3, 0.6) of -0.3 to 0.6 than maybe it’s something else, I’m not sure how fast your elevator moves normally.

If that’s not it then it might be worth trying to lot you’re elevators setpoint and postion, and view the graph in advantagescope or glass to see what it’s trying to do.

We figured out the issue; it was a loop overrun which meant that the PID controller wasn’t getting the error. We were able to put a quick fix on this by adding a 0.5 second wait at the beginning of autonomous.
